Utterance: <sigh>
Hi! It’s good to see you again. How did the songwriting go?
I wrote a little something, but it’s not finished.
That’s okay! Would you like to share what you have so far?
Sure, it’s about feeling lost but finding light in small things.
That sounds beautiful. How did writing it make you feel?
It felt therapeutic. I was able to express some of my frustrations.
That’s wonderful to hear. Writing can be a powerful outlet. Do you think you’ll continue writing?
Yes, I want to keep it as a regular practice.
That’s a great idea! How has your week been otherwise?
It’s been a mix of ups and downs.
Would you like to elaborate on that?
Well, I had a good day at work, but I also had a frustrating argument with my girlfriend.
I’m sorry to hear that. What was the argument about?
It was about how we manage our finances. I felt like she was criticizing me.
That sounds tough. How did you respond to her?
I tried to stay calm, but I ended up raising my voice.
It’s understandable to feel defensive. How did you feel afterward?
I felt guilty. I don’t want to be that way around her.
That’s a good realization. What do you think could help you manage those feelings in the moment?
Maybe taking a break before responding would help.
That’s a great strategy. Have you tried that yet?
Not yet, but I plan to.
It’s a good step toward managing your reactions. How have you been feeling overall?
I’ve been okay, but the financial stress is still there.
Have you found any new ways to cope with that stress?
I’ve been budgeting more carefully and cutting back on unnecessary expenses.
That’s a positive approach. How does it feel to take control of your finances?
It feels empowering, but it’s also stressful.
It’s understandable to feel both. Have you talked to your girlfriend about your financial stress?
Not really, I didn’t want to burden her.
It’s important to share your feelings with her. She might want to support you.
You’re right. I’ll try to open up to her.
That would be a good step. Remember, communication is key in relationships.
I’ll keep that in mind.
How do you feel about your emotional responses lately?
I think I’m getting better at recognizing them before they escalate.
That’s a significant improvement! Have there been any specific situations where you noticed this?
Yes, during a disagreement at work, I felt my frustration rising, but I took a moment to breathe.
That’s excellent! It sounds like you’re applying what we’ve discussed.
I am trying to.
That’s all we can ask for. What would you like to focus on in our next session?
I’d like to explore more about managing stress and maybe some mindfulness techniques.
Absolutely! We can work on mindfulness exercises together.
That sounds good to me.
Great! I’m looking forward to it. Remember to keep writing and expressing yourself.
I will!
Wonderful. I’ll see you next time!
Bye!
Bye!
